JavaScript.question: (2) What is Array ??
JavaScript.answer: JavaScript arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable.

JavaScript.question: (3) what is closure in javascript ??
JavaScript.answer: Closure means that an inner function always has access to the vars and parameters of its outer function, even after the outer function has returned.

JavaScript.question: (4) What is BOM in javascript ??
JavaScript.answer: The Browser Object Model (BOM) in JavaScript includes the properties and methods for JavaScript to interact with the web browser.BOM Provide us a window object.

JavaScript.question: (5) What is DOM in javascript ??
JavaScript.answer: The Document Object Model (DOM) is a programming interface for HTML and XML documents.The DOM is an object-oriented representation of the web page, which can be modified with a scripting language such as JavaScript.

JavaScript.question: (8) What is the difference between == and ===?
JavaScript.answer: The == operator checks equality of values only whereas === checks equality of values, and data type.

HTMLCss.question: (6)  What is the difference between class selectors and id selectors ??
HTMLCss.answer: An overall block is given to class selector while id selectors take only a single element differing from other elements.

HTMLCss.question: (8)  Explain the difference between visibility: hidden and display: none ??
HTMLCss.answer:
visibility: hidden hides the element, but it occupies space and affects the layout of the document.
display: none also hides the element but not occupy space. It will not affect the layout of the document.

HTMLCss.question: (9) How many type of inline Elements ??
HTMLCss.answer: An inline element does not start on a new line.

HTMLCss.question: (10) How many type of Block Elements ??
HTMLCss.answer: An Block Elements is start on a new line.

HTMLCss.question: (11) What are the Diffrent Between HTML 4.0 and HTML 5 ??
(12) What are the difference Between Svg  and Canvas ??
HTMLCss.answer:
SVG: The Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) is an XML-based image format that is used to define two-dimensional vector-based graphics for the web. Unlike raster image (Ex .jpg, .gif, .png, etc.), a vector image can be scaled up or down to any extent without losing the image quality.

Canvas: The HTML element is used to draw graphics on the fly, via scripting (usually JavaScript). The element is only a container for graphics. You must use a script to actually draw the graphics. Canvas has several methods for drawing paths, boxes, circles, text, and adding images.

HTMLCss.question: (14) what is the difference between local storage and session storage  ??
HTMLCss.answer: sessionStorage is similar to localStorage ; the difference is that while data in localStorage doesn't expire, data in sessionStorage is cleared when the page session ends. ... A page session lasts as long as the tab or the browser is open, and survives over page reloads and restores.
